required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anti-CD19 CAR-T Therapy Bridging to HSCT for CD19+ B-Cell Malignancies
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1/2 Study Evaluating the Safety and Efficacy of Anti-CD19 Chimeric Antigen Receptor-Modified T Cell (CAR-T) Therapy Bridging to Hematological Stem Cell Transplantation (HSCT) for Relapsed/Refractory CD19+ B-Cell Malignancies

lead_sponsor.agency: Wuhan Sian Medical Technology Co., Ltd

clinical_study.source: Wuhan Sian Medical Technology Co., Ltd

brief_summary.textblock: This is the second stage of the previous anti-CD19 CAR-T therapy (NCT02965092). The study aims to evaluate the safety and efficacy of consolidative allo-HSCT following CAR-T therapy in patients with relapsed or refractory B cell Malignancies.

detailed_description.textblock: Anti-CD19 CAR-T therapy has been confirmed effective for relapsed/refractory B-cell malignancies. However, its ability to keep patients in maintained remission is limited. In order to keep patients in long-term remissions, patients who had achieved MRD-negative complete remissions through CAR-T therapy (NCT02965092) will, on their own accord, receive allo-HSCT if there are no previous HSCT, contraindications, and other restrictions.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients receive consolidative allo-HSCT following CAR-T therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse events
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the safety of anti-CD19 CAR-T therapy bridging to allo-HSCT. Therapy-related adverse events were recorded and assessed according to the National Cancer Institute's Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE, Version 4.0)

secondary_outcome.description: OS was calculated from the date of inclusion to death or last follow-up (censored).
EFS was calculated from the date of inclusion to death, progression of the disease, relapse or gene recurrence, whichever came first, or last visit (censored).
RFS was calculated from the date of inclusion to relapse or last visit (censored).

arm_group.description: Patients who had achieved MRD-negative complete remissions through CAR-T therapy (NCT02965092) will, on their own accord, receive allo-HSCT if there are no previous HSCT, contraindications, and other restrictions.

intervention.description: Patients receive allogeneic hematological stem cell transplantation after they achieve MRD- CR through CAR-T therapy.

facility.name: Union Hospital, Tongji Medical College, Huazhong University of Science and Technology
